intro: Oxystophyllum moluccense, commonly known as the Moluccan oxystophyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and prefers well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are usually large and heart-shaped, while its flowers are typically pink or red with a prominent yellow center. Oxystophyllum moluccense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
